content.description: Steep arete directly right of a tree. This tree is extremely close to the route and is growing up the wall about half way. I have not climbed this route, but it does not appear to get in the way of any holds or bolts that can be seen from the ground.
content.protection: 5 Bolts to a shared two bold cold shut anchor.
content.location: Directly right of the pine tree. Facing South.

content.description: The crux is the first few moves going up and left to the first bolt. After the first bolt the holds become bigger and the route slightly less than vertical trending up and right to the shared anchor with Ugly Arete.
content.protection: 4-5 Bolts to a shared cold shut anchor
content.location: Left of the pine tree growing up the wall.

climbs.name: Double Take
climbs.fa: Tom Herbert, Tim Bluhm, Mark Sundeen, 1987

content.description: Slab climb that has crumbly rock and a significant amount of lichen. Starts in a low angle dish to the right of a flake then goes up slab to an opposite facing flake. Anchor over the lip.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: On the boulder behind the Ugly Arete Boulder. Facing South.

content.description: Starts right of Ugly Arete on a slightly low angle seam and gets steeper after the second bolt. Continue up the right side of the arete until you pull a small lip, then go up and left to the shared anchor of Ugly Arete.
content.location: Right of the Ugly Arete. The start of the climb faces East and starts on a seam/crack.
